parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "cores": 8,
    "nodes": 1,
    "runtime": "20 hours",
    "partition": "aagk80",
    "gpu": "cuda-7.5",
    "memory_per_cpu": "1024 MB",
    "job_name": "music80_04_melodicity",
    "output_file": "OGAN.out",
    "email_notifications": ["FAIL", "END"],
    "email_address": "gabrielguimaraes@college.harvard.edu",
    "environment": {
      "OMP_NUM_THREADS": 8,
      "modules": [
        "cuda/7.5-fasrc02",
        "cudnn/7.0-fasrc02",
        "gcc/4.9.3-fasrc01",
        "tensorflow/1.0.0-fasrc04"
      ],
      "virtual_environment": "tfgpu"
    },
    "python_script": "train_ogan.py",
    "scratch_directory": "/scratch",
    "results_directory": "current directory"
  }
}
``` 

This script is a SLURM script. It defines a job that utilizes 8 cores on a single machine for 20 hours. The script specifies the partition to submit the job to (aagk80), the GPU constraint (cuda-7.5), the memory allocated per core (1024 MB), and the job name. It also sets up email notifications for failure and completion of the job. 

The script then sets the number of threads for OpenMP, loads necessary modules for CUDA, cuDNN, GCC, and TensorFlow, activates a virtual environment named "tfgpu", and defines variables for the job. 

Next, the script sets up a scratch directory and copies the content of the current directory to it. It then runs a Python script named "train_ogan.py", writes the output to a file named "results.out" and moves the results to the current directory. Finally, it creates a dummy file to mark the job as finished.
